subject: A good way to end the day

Not a question. Just a thought.

I do java almost daily and all the java I ever did was test first (only two
years now). I love it and I realy wouldn't know where to start coding if I
didn't have my test first.

When I started java and test first I loved to see the green bar. A good way
to end the day was to see that green bar (I mainly used the GUI version
then). Going home (or to another task) with all tests running 100% was a
realy good feeling.

As time has gone, I've interestingly found that going home with a few
failing tests shortly after having had all tests pass is an even bester way
to end the day. "Picking-up-time" is much shorter when I arrive in the
morning or when I pick up the project after having worked on something else
for a while. There is no need to take notes to avoid the "where did I get
to". The failing tests take my thoughts right to the place they were when I
left off. I even find that when I do this I better "let go" of my project
when I'm not working on it.

So my tip, end the day in fresh red.

Morten
